trans-unit.source: Set up protection with a single VMM server
trans-unit.target: Set up protection with a single VMM server

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines located in on-premises VMM clouds to Azure or to a secondary VMM cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery coordinates the replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines located in on-premises VMM clouds to Azure or to a secondary VMM cloud.

trans-unit.source: Set up protection with a single VMM server
trans-unit.target: Set up protection with a single VMM server

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of deployment scenarios see [Azure Site Recovery overview](site-recovery-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of deployment scenarios see [Azure Site Recovery overview](site-recovery-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: If you only have a single VMM server in your infrastructure you can deploy Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines in VMM clouds to Azure, or you can replicate between clouds on a single VMM server.
trans-unit.target: If you only have a single VMM server in your infrastructure you can deploy Site Recovery to replicate virtual machines in VMM clouds to Azure, or you can replicate between clouds on a single VMM server.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you only do this if you're unable to deploy two VMM servers (one in each site) since failover and recovery isn't seamless in this deployment.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you only do this if you're unable to deploy two VMM servers (one in each site) since failover and recovery isn't seamless in this deployment.

trans-unit.source: For recovery you'll need to manually fail over the VMM server from outside the Azure Site Recovery console (using Hyper-V Replica in the Hyper-V Manager console).
trans-unit.target: For recovery you'll need to manually fail over the VMM server from outside the Azure Site Recovery console (using Hyper-V Replica in the Hyper-V Manager console).

trans-unit.source: You can set up replication using a single VMM server in a couple of ways:
trans-unit.target: You can set up replication using a single VMM server in a couple of ways:

trans-unit.source: Standalone deployment
trans-unit.target: Standalone deployment

trans-unit.source: Deploy a standalone VMM server as a virtual machine in a primary site, and replicate this virtual machine to a secondary site with Site Recovery and Hyper-V Replica.
trans-unit.target: Deploy a standalone VMM server as a virtual machine in a primary site, and replicate this virtual machine to a secondary site with Site Recovery and Hyper-V Replica.

trans-unit.source: To reduce downtime the SQL Server can be installed on the VMM virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: To reduce downtime the SQL Server can be installed on the VMM virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If VMM is using a remote SQL Server you'll need to recover that first before recovering the VMM server.
trans-unit.target: If VMM is using a remote SQL Server you'll need to recover that first before recovering the VMM server.

trans-unit.source: Standalone virtual VMM server
trans-unit.target: Standalone virtual VMM server

trans-unit.source: Cluster deployment
trans-unit.target: Cluster deployment

trans-unit.source: To make VMM highly available it can be deployed as a virtual machine in a Windows failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: To make VMM highly available it can be deployed as a virtual machine in a Windows failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: This is useful if critical workloads are being managed by VMM because it ensures workload availability and protects against hardware failover of the host on which VMM is running.
trans-unit.target: This is useful if critical workloads are being managed by VMM because it ensures workload availability and protects against hardware failover of the host on which VMM is running.

trans-unit.source: To deploy a single VMM server with Site Recovery the VMM virtual machine should be deployed over a stretch cluster across geographically separate sites.
trans-unit.target: To deploy a single VMM server with Site Recovery the VMM virtual machine should be deployed over a stretch cluster across geographically separate sites.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server database used by VMM should be protected with SQL Server AlwaysOn availability groups with a replica on the secondary site.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server database used by VMM should be protected with SQL Server AlwaysOn availability groups with a replica on the secondary site.

trans-unit.source: If disaster occurs the VMM server and it's corresponding SQL Server database are failed over and accessed from the secondary site.
trans-unit.target: If disaster occurs the VMM server and it's corresponding SQL Server database are failed over and accessed from the secondary site.

trans-unit.source: Clustered virtual VMM server
trans-unit.target: Clustered virtual VMM server

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: The walkthrough steps explain how to deploy Site Recovery with a single standalone VMM server.
trans-unit.target: The walkthrough steps explain how to deploy Site Recovery with a single standalone VMM server.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have the [prerequisites](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#before-you-start) in place before you start deployment.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have the [prerequisites](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#before-you-start) in place before you start deployment.

trans-unit.source: The single VMM server must have at least two clouds configured.
trans-unit.target: The single VMM server must have at least two clouds configured.

trans-unit.source: One cloud will act as the protected cloud and the other is performing protection.
trans-unit.target: One cloud will act as the protected cloud and the other is performing protection.

trans-unit.source: The clouds that you want to protect must contain the following:
trans-unit.target: The clouds that you want to protect must contain the following:

trans-unit.source: One or more VMM host groups
trans-unit.target: One or more VMM host groups

trans-unit.source: One or more Hyper-V host servers in each host group
trans-unit.target: One or more Hyper-V host servers in each host group

trans-unit.source: One or more Hyper-V virtual machines on each host server
trans-unit.target: One or more Hyper-V virtual machines on each host server

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems setting up this scenario post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems setting up this scenario post your questions on the [Azure Recovery Services Forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/azure/home?forum=hypervrecovmgr).

trans-unit.source: Configure a single server deployment
trans-unit.target: Configure a single server deployment

trans-unit.source: If VMM isn't deployed, set up VMM on a virtual machine with a SQL Server database installed.
trans-unit.target: If VMM isn't deployed, set up VMM on a virtual machine with a SQL Server database installed.

trans-unit.source: Read [system requirements](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn771747.aspx)
trans-unit.target: Read [system requirements](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn771747.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Set up at least two clouds on the VMM server.
trans-unit.target: Set up at least two clouds on the VMM server.

trans-unit.source: Learn more at:
trans-unit.target: Learn more at:

trans-unit.source: [What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM](http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/TechEd/NorthAmerica/2013/MDC-B357#fbid=) and in [VMM 2012 and the clouds](http://www.server-log.com/blog/2011/8/26/vmm-2012-and-the-clouds.html).
trans-unit.target: [What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM](http://channel9.msdn.com/Events/TechEd/NorthAmerica/2013/MDC-B357#fbid=) and in [VMM 2012 and the clouds](http://www.server-log.com/blog/2011/8/26/vmm-2012-and-the-clouds.html).

trans-unit.source: Configuring the VMM cloud fabric
trans-unit.target: Configuring the VMM cloud fabric

trans-unit.source: [Creating a private cloud in VMM](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj860425.aspx) and [Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM](http://blogs.technet.com/b/keithmayer/archive/2013/04/18/walkthrough-creating-private-clouds-with-system-center-2012-sp1-virtual-machine-manager-build-your-private-cloud-in-a-month.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [Creating a private cloud in VMM](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/jj860425.aspx) and [Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM](http://blogs.technet.com/b/keithmayer/archive/2013/04/18/walkthrough-creating-private-clouds-with-system-center-2012-sp1-virtual-machine-manager-build-your-private-cloud-in-a-month.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Add the source Hyper-V host server on which the virtual machine you want to protect is located to the cloud you're going to protect (the source cloud).
trans-unit.target: Add the source Hyper-V host server on which the virtual machine you want to protect is located to the cloud you're going to protect (the source cloud).

trans-unit.source: Add the target Hyper-V host server to the cloud on the VMM server that will be providing the protection.
trans-unit.target: Add the target Hyper-V host server to the cloud on the VMM server that will be providing the protection.

trans-unit.source: [Create](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-1-create-a-site-recovery-vault) an Azure Site Recovery vault and generate a vault registration key.
trans-unit.target: [Create](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-1-create-a-site-recovery-vault) an Azure Site Recovery vault and generate a vault registration key.

trans-unit.source: [Install](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-3-install-the-azure-site-recovery-provider) the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server and register the server in the vault.
trans-unit.target: [Install](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-3-install-the-azure-site-recovery-provider) the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the VMM server and register the server in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the clouds appear in the Site Recovery portal, and [configure cloud protection settings](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-4-configure-cloud-protection-settings).
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the clouds appear in the Site Recovery portal, and [configure cloud protection settings](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-4-configure-cloud-protection-settings).

trans-unit.source: In **Source Location** and **Target Location**, specify the name of the single VMM server.
trans-unit.target: In **Source Location** and **Target Location**, specify the name of the single VMM server.

trans-unit.source: In **Replication Method**, select **Over the network** for the initial replication because the clouds are located on the same server.
trans-unit.target: In **Replication Method**, select **Over the network** for the initial replication because the clouds are located on the same server.

trans-unit.source: Optionally [configure network mapping](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-5-configure-network-mapping):
trans-unit.target: Optionally [configure network mapping](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-5-configure-network-mapping):

trans-unit.source: In **Source** and **Target** specify the name of the single VMM server.
trans-unit.target: In **Source** and **Target** specify the name of the single VMM server.

trans-unit.source: In **Network on Source** select the VM network that’s configured for the cloud you’re protecting.
trans-unit.target: In **Network on Source** select the VM network that’s configured for the cloud you’re protecting.

trans-unit.source: In **Network on Target** select the VM network that’s configured for the cloud you want to use for protection.
trans-unit.target: In **Network on Target** select the VM network that’s configured for the cloud you want to use for protection.

trans-unit.source: Network mapping can be configured between two virtual machine (VM) networks on the same VMM server.
trans-unit.target: Network mapping can be configured between two virtual machine (VM) networks on the same VMM server.

trans-unit.source: If the same VMM network exists in two different sites, you can map between the same networks.
trans-unit.target: If the same VMM network exists in two different sites, you can map between the same networks.

trans-unit.source: [Enable protection](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-7-enable-virtual-machine-protection) for virtual machines in the VMM cloud you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: [Enable protection](site-recovery-vmm-to-vmm.md/#step-7-enable-virtual-machine-protection) for virtual machines in the VMM cloud you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: In the Hyper-V Manager console, set up replication for the VMM virtual machine with Hyper-V Replica.
trans-unit.target: In the Hyper-V Manager console, set up replication for the VMM virtual machine with Hyper-V Replica.

trans-unit.source: The VMM virtual machine shouldn't be added to any VMM clouds.
trans-unit.target: The VMM virtual machine shouldn't be added to any VMM clouds.

trans-unit.source: Failover and recover
trans-unit.target: Failover and recover

trans-unit.source: Create recovery plans
trans-unit.target: Create recovery plans

trans-unit.source: Recovery plans group together virtual machines that should be failed over and recovered together.
trans-unit.target: Recovery plans group together virtual machines that should be failed over and recovered together.

trans-unit.source: When you create a recovery plan in **Source** and **Target** specify the name of the single VMM server.
trans-unit.target: When you create a recovery plan in **Source** and **Target** specify the name of the single VMM server.

trans-unit.source: In **Select Virtual Machines**, virtual machines that are associated with the primary cloud will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: In **Select Virtual Machines**, virtual machines that are associated with the primary cloud will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Then [create and customize recovery plans](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn337331.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Then [create and customize recovery plans](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn337331.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Recovery
trans-unit.target: Recovery

trans-unit.source: In the event of a disaster workloads can be recovered using the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the event of a disaster workloads can be recovered using the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Manually fail over the replica VMM virtual machine to the recovery site from the Hyper-V Manager console.
trans-unit.target: Manually fail over the replica VMM virtual machine to the recovery site from the Hyper-V Manager console.

trans-unit.source: After the VMM virtual machine has been recovered, you can log into the Hyper-V Recovery Manager console from the portal and do an unplanned failover of the virtual machines from the primary to the recovery site.
trans-unit.target: After the VMM virtual machine has been recovered, you can log into the Hyper-V Recovery Manager console from the portal and do an unplanned failover of the virtual machines from the primary to the recovery site.

trans-unit.source: After the unplanned failover finishes users can access all the resources at the primary site.
trans-unit.target: After the unplanned failover finishes users can access all the resources at the primary site.
